name: K2-186
scenarioDescription:
The K2-186 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-186 is a star with 1.02 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.98 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

K2-186 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-186 system


K2-186 b

K2-186 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-186 b is 10.207799999999999 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-186 b is 3.172 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-186 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-186, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
